discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct:

questions.question_text:
The company has very tight controls on procurement and requires that all licenses keys be annotated to include the purchase order used to acquire them whenever possible.
During a routine audit, the new VMware Cloud Foundation environment was found to be missing the details for the vSAN license keys. An administrator has been tasked with updating the license key description to include this information.
Where should the administrator go in order to edit the license key description?

choices.B: VMware vCenter Server > Hosts and Clusters
choices.D: VMware vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager > Locker

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been tasked with deploying an NSX Edge Cluster within a VI Workload Domain to support container workloads on VMware Cloud Foundation with Tanzu.
Which use case option should be selected during the Add Edge Cluster Wizard to ensure that the correct settings are applied and cannot be edited?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
predefined configuration for Tanzu

questions.question_text: Which VMware Cloud Foundation edition allows the administrator to do large scale workload migration from old environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B
https://www.techtarget.com/searchdatacenter/feature/Understanding-VMware-Cloud-Foundation-components-features#:~:text=Enterprise%20edition%20builds%20on%20the%20Advanced%20edition%2C%20adding%20management%2C%20storage%20and%20networking%20capabilities%20not%20available%20to%20any%20of%20the%20other%20three%20editions.%20For%20example%2C%20the%20Enterprise%20edition%20supports%20data%2Dat%2Drest%20encryption%20and%20NSX%20Hybrid%20Connect%2C%20which%20enables%20large%2Dscale%20workload%20migrations.

Selected Answer: B
same as the other contributors

Selected Answer: B
I think B is the correct answer

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-21ABC792-0A23-40EF-8D37-0367B483585E.html

choices.D: Supervisor Cluster mandates using vSAN to provide storage resources to Tanzu Kubernetes clusters.
choices.C: Supervisor Cluster mandates using NSX-T to service Tanzu Kubernetes clusters networking.
choices.A: Supervisor Cluster requires using vSAN to provide storage resources to vSphere Pods.
choices.B: Supervisor Cluster requires using NSX-T to service vSphere Pods networking.

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about vSphere with Tanzu Supervisor Cluster?

An administrator is planning to deploy a VMware Cloud Foundation with Tanzu cluster.
Which three requirements must be considered when configuring the Workload Management? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
should be right

choices.D: All ESXi hosts that are part of workload domain must have 'VMware vSphere 7 Enterprise Plus with Add-on for Kubernetes' license.
choices.E: All ESXi hosts that are part of workload domain must have 'VMware vSphere 7 Enterprise' license.
choices.A: A large format NSX-T Edge cluster must have been deployed.
choices.B: Use routable subnets for Kubernetes cluster egress and ingress for the NSX-T edge cluster.
choices.F: Use a routable subnet for pod networking.
choices.C: Use a routable subnet for Service IP addresses.
